etymology.description: Depicts a human head above a horizontal line, symbolizing the origin or the head of something
etymology.interpretation: 元(元) (yuán, 'origin') represents the head, which is often considered the starting point or leader, aligning with the concept of 'origin'. This setup also connects metaphorically to beginnings or first principles.

examples.chinese: 万物之元来自于混沌(萬物之元來自於混沌)。
examples.pinyin: Wànwù zhī yuán láizì yú húndùn.
examples.english: The origin of all things comes from chaos.

examples.chinese: 道家的理念追寻心灵的元(道家的理念追尋心靈的元)。
examples.pinyin: Dàojiā de lǐniàn zhuīxún xīnlíng de yuán.
examples.english: Taoist philosophy seeks the origin of the soul.
